result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Braeden R Ward

defendant.name: Ward, Braeden R
defendant.address: 4790 W Maple Leaf Circle, Greenfield, WI 53220

records.addlTxt: An Amended Information was filed.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Court finds the State has complied with victim/ witness notification.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Parties do not request a Presentence Investigation Report.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor, ammunition or explosives.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.   Defendant REMANDED.   mn

Defendant Braeden R Ward in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Braeden R Ward.  Assistant District Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Braeden R Ward not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Braeden R Ward.  Assistant District Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's appearance waived.  Defense has received offer and discovery and requests a date for plea hearing.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Plea hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Braeden R Ward not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Braeden R Ward.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests additional time to review discovery.  Court adjourned the matter and scheduled a scheduling conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 45, Rm G55A CJF.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Braeden R Ward not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel needs to review discovery.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Braeden R Ward in court, appear by video with attorney Michael B Plaisted, appear in person.  Defendant Braeden R Ward in custody.  Grant Ian-Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Braeden R Ward in court, in custody, CJF.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Braeden R Ward appeared by video means.  Tom Reed from SPD appears.  Court cannot find good cause for adjournment.  Court appoints Attorney Michael Plaisted to represent defendant at the hourly rate of $100 to be paid by Milwaukee County.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Braeden R Ward not in court, defendant in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Patricia N, Ann N, and Scott P N.

Defendant Braeden R Ward in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Braeden R Ward in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Braeden R Ward appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
